snippet: Efraín Ríos Montt was taken to a military hospital on Monday after fainting while on his way to a court hearing, the Guatemalan prison authorities said.
abstract: Guatemala's former dictator Efrain Rios Montt, who has received 80-year sentence for genocide and crimes against humanity, is taken to a military hospital after fainting while on his way to a court hearing.
lead_paragraph: Efraín Ríos Montt was taken to a military hospital on Monday after fainting while on his way to a court hearing, the Guatemalan prison authorities said.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
